comments:
I got this Friday night testing disconnecting/sharing with our new persistent 
property support.  Decorators were on.

I believe there may be a timing issue with decorators accessing the resource 
tree when they are not supposed to.  I've been unable to reproduce it.

The stack looks like:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 271 Jun 07, 2002 22:07:43.710
!MESSAGE Could not read from indexed store: 
c:\eclipse_workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.projects\Tes
tMar4x2\.properties.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.indexing.ObjectStore.acquireObject
(ObjectStore.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.indexing.IndexedStore.acquireObject
(IndexedStore.java(Compiled Code))
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.indexing.IndexedStore.acquireBinarySmallObject
(IndexedStore.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.indexing.IndexedStore.getObject
(IndexedStore.java:297)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.indexing.IndexedStore.getObjectAsString
(IndexedStore.java:307)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.properties.IndexedStoreWrapper.getObjectAsString
(IndexedStoreWrapper.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.properties.PropertyStore.visitPropertyAt
(PropertyStore.java:440)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.properties.PropertyStore.recordsMatching
(PropertyStore.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.properties.PropertyManager.getProperty
(PropertyManager.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.properties.PropertyManager.getProperty
(PropertyManager.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.getPersistentProperty
(Resource.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.team.core.RepositoryProvider.getProvider
(RepositoryProvider.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSDecorationRunnable.decorate
(CVSDecorationRunnable.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSDecorationRunnable.run
(CVSDecorationRunnable.java:105)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:498)

We made the property store thread safe.  This should solve the problem in this 
bug report.  If you experience this again in a >= F3 build, please reopen.
